instance_methods.name: color_distance
instance_methods.doc: Gets the absolute [Color Distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Color_difference) between *color1* to *color*2
instance_methods.summary: Gets the absolute Color Distance between color1 to color2

instance_methods.name: from_image
instance_methods.doc:
Converts a `Raylib::Image` to a `WAD::Flat` given the *image* and the *palette*

NOTE: The image has to be 64x64 and have no transparent pixels

```
my_wad = WAD.read("Path/To/Wad")

palette = my_wad.playpal.palettes[0]

my_image = Raylib.gen_image_color(64, 64, Raylib::RED)

my_image_flat = WAD::Flat.from_image(my_image, palette)
```
instance_methods.summary: Converts a Raylib::Image to a WAD::Flat given the image and the palette

def.name: from_image
def.body:
if (image.width != 64) || (image.height != 64)
  raise("A FLAT NEEDS TO BE 64x64. *image* IS #{image.width}x#{image.height}")
end


current_closest_color : Tuple(Raylib::Color, UInt8, Int32) = {Raylib::BLACK, 0_u8, 0}
flat = ::WAD::Flat.new

image.height.times do |y|
  image.width.times do |x|
    current_image_color = Raylib.get_image_color(image, x, y)

    if current_image_color.a != 0
      raylib_palette_color = Raylib::Color.new(r: palette.colors[0].r, g: palette.colors[0].g, b: palette.colors[0].b, a: 255)

      current_closest_color = {raylib_palette_color, 0_u8, color_distance(current_image_color, raylib_palette_color)}

      palette.colors.each.with_index do |color, index|
        raylib_palette_color = Raylib::Color.new(r: color.r, g: color.g, b: color.b, a: 255)
        if (current_distance = color_distance(current_image_color, raylib_palette_color)) < current_closest_color[2]
          current_closest_color = {raylib_palette_color, index.to_u8, current_distance}
        end
      end

      flat.colors << current_closest_color[1]
    else
      raise("Pixel x: #{x}, y: #{y} is transparent. Flats can not have transparent pixels")
    end
  end
end

return flat

for the pixel of a graphic

Gets the [Raylib Color](https://github.com/raysan5/raylib/blob/c147ab51c92abb09af5a5bc93759c7d360b8e1be/src/raylib.h#L235C6-L235C6)
of the pixel [2, 4] and draws it:
```
require "wa-cr/raylib"

  0,

  my_pixel

```
instance_methods.summary: Returns a Raylib Color for the pixel of a graphic

def.name: get_pixel
def.body:
if x > width || y > height
  raise("Out of bounds")
end
if pixel = self[x, y]
  palette_r = palette.colors[pixel].r
  palette_g = palette.colors[pixel].g
  palette_b = palette.colors[pixel].b
  return Raylib::Color.new(r: palette_r, g: palette_g, b: palette_b, a: 255)
else
  return Raylib::Color.new(r: 0, g: 0, b: 0, a: 0)
end

data.each_with_index do |p, i|
  if p.nil?
    next
  end
  palette_r = palette.colors[p].r
  palette_g = palette.colors[p].g
  palette_b = palette.colors[p].b
  Raylib.image_draw_pixel(pointerof(image), i % width, (i / width).to_i, Raylib::Color.new(r: palette_r, g: palette_g, b: palette_b, a: 255))
end

instance_methods.name: from_image
instance_methods.doc:
Converts a `Raylib::Image` to a `WAD::Graphic` given the *filename*, the *palette*, and the *offset*

NOTE: If you get an arithmetic overflow error at any point, chances are that your image is too big

```
my_wad = WAD.read("Path/To/Wad")

palette = my_wad.playpal.palettes[0]

my_image = Raylib.gen_image_color(100, 80, Raylib::RED)

my_image_graphic = WAD::Graphic.from_image(my_image, palette, WAD::Graphic::Offsets::BottomCenter)
```
instance_methods.summary: Converts a Raylib::Image to a WAD::Graphic given the filename, the palette, and the offset
instance_methods.args_html: (image : Raylib::Image, palette : ::WAD::Playpal::Palette, offset : ::WAD::Graphic::Offsets = ::WAD::Graphic::Offsets::TopLeft) : ::WAD::Graphic

def.name: from_image
def.body:
offsets = [[0_i16, 0_i16], [0_i16, (image.width // 2).to_i16], [0_i16, image.width.to_i16], [(image.height // 2).to_i16, 0_i16], [(image.height // 2).to_i16, (image.width // 2).to_i16], [(image.height // 2).to_i16, image.width.to_i16], [image.height.to_i16, 0_i16], [image.height.to_i16, (image.width // 2).to_i16], [image.height.to_i16, image.width.to_i16]]

current_closest_color : Tuple(Raylib::Color, UInt8, Int32) = {Raylib::BLACK, 0_u8, 0}
graphic = ::WAD::Graphic.new

graphic.topoffset = offsets[offset.value][0]
graphic.leftoffset = offsets[offset.value][1]

graphic.width = image.width.to_u16
graphic.height = image.height.to_u16
graphic.reset_data

image.height.times do |y|
  image.width.times do |x|
    current_image_color = Raylib.get_image_color(image, x, y)

    if current_image_color.a != 0
      raylib_palette_color = Raylib::Color.new(r: palette.colors[0].r, g: palette.colors[0].g, b: palette.colors[0].b, a: 255)

      current_closest_color = {raylib_palette_color, 0_u8, color_distance(current_image_color, raylib_palette_color)}

      palette.colors.each.with_index do |color, index|
        raylib_palette_color = Raylib::Color.new(r: color.r, g: color.g, b: color.b, a: 255)
        if (current_distance = color_distance(current_image_color, raylib_palette_color)) < current_closest_color[2]
          current_closest_color = {raylib_palette_color, index.to_u8, current_distance}
        end
      end

      graphic.data[x + (y * graphic.width)] = current_closest_color[1]
    end
  end
end

return graphic

instance_methods.doc:
Gets a texture as a [Raylib Image](https://github.com/raysan5/raylib/blob/c147ab51c92abb09af5a5bc93759c7d360b8e1be/src/raylib.h#L251)
given the texture name and a palette

Takes the name of a texture from TextureX and a palette
and converts the texture to a [Raylib Image](https://github.com/raysan5/raylib/blob/c147ab51c92abb09af5a5bc93759c7d360b8e1be/src/raylib.h#L251)
and draws that image:
```
require "wa-cr/raylib"

my_image = my_wad.get_texture("STARTAN3", palette)
Raylib.draw_texture(
  Raylib.load_texture_from_image(my_image),

  0,
  Raylib::WHITE

instance_methods.summary: Gets a texture as a Raylib Image given the texture name and a palette

def.name: get_texture
def.body:
texmaps.values.each do |texmapx|
  if texturemap = texmapx.mtextures.find do |m| m.name == name end
    if texturemap.name == name
      image = Raylib.gen_image_color(texturemap.width, texturemap.height, Raylib::BLANK)

      texturemap.patches.each do |texmap_patch|
        patch_name = pnames.patches[texmap_patch.patch]
        patch_image = graphics[patch_name.upcase.gsub("\u0000", "")].to_image(palette)
        Raylib.image_draw(pointerof(image), patch_image, Raylib::Rectangle.new(x: 0, y: 0, width: patch_image.width, height: patch_image.height), Raylib::Rectangle.new(x: texmap_patch.originx, y: texmap_patch.originy, width: patch_image.width, height: patch_image.height), Raylib::WHITE)
        Raylib.unload_image(patch_image)
      end
      return image
    end
  end
end
return Raylib.gen_image_color(64, 64, Raylib::PURPLE)

types.name: WAD

constants.name: HEADER_SIZE
constants.doc: The size of the header in bytes
constants.summary: The size of the header in bytes

types.doc:
### Reading a .WAD file's data

To simply read in a WAD file, you just call `WAD.read(file : Path | String | IO) : WAD`:

```
my_string_wad = WAD.read("Path/To/Wad")
my_path_wad = WAD.read(Path["Path/To/Wad"])

File.open("Path/To/Wad") do |file|
  my_io_wad = WAD.read(file)
end
```

### Creating a new `WAD`

To create a new `WAD`, you call `WAD.new(type)`, with type being of `WAD::Type`

```
my_new_internal_wad = WAD.new(WAD::Type::Internal)
my_new_patch_wad = WAD.new(WAD::Type::Patch)
```

### Using the `WAD`'s data

wa-cr sorts the the parsed wad's data into easy to use variables.

To get the sample rate of the sound *"MYSOUND"*:

```
my_wad.sounds["MYSOUND"].sample_rate # => returns the sample rate of the sound
```

To get *y_position* of the 34th thing in the map *"MAP23"*:

```
# Gets the thing index 33 because it is zero indexed: the 33rd index is the 34th thing
my_wad.maps["MAP23"].things[33].y_position # => returns the y_position of the thing
```

### Lumps

You can also read in .lmp lump files:

NOTE: `Graphic.parse` can take 2 arguments: The file to read and
the position of the start of the data (Default is -1. Should almost always be -1 when reading a .lmp)
```
my_string_graphic = WAD::Graphic.parse("Path/To/MyGraphic.lmp")
my_path_graphic = WAD::Graphic.parse(Path["Path/To/MyGraphic.lmp"])

File.open("Path/To/MyGraphic.lmp") do |file|
  my_io_graphic = WAD::Graphic.parse(file)
end
```
```
my_string_flat = WAD::Flat.parse("Path/To/MyFlat.lmp")
my_path_flat = WAD::Flat.parse(Path["Path/To/MyFlat.lmp"])

File.open("Path/To/MyFlat.lmp") do |file|
  my_io_flat = WAD::Flat.parse(file)
end
```
```
my_string_sound = WAD::Sound.parse("Path/To/MySound.lmp")
my_path_sound = WAD::Sound.parse(Path["Path/To/MySound.lmp"])

File.open("Path/To/MySound.lmp") do |file|
  my_io_sound = WAD::Sound.parse(file)
end
```
types.summary: Reading a .WAD file's data

class_methods.name: slice_cut
class_methods.doc:
Cuts a slice down to length *len* if it is larger than *len*:

```
my_slice = "My Test Slice".to_slice # => Bytes[77, 121, 32, 84, 101, 115, 116, 32, 83, 108, 105, 99, 101]
WAD.slice_cut(my_slice, 5)          # => Bytes[77, 121, 32, 84, 101]
```
class_methods.summary: Cuts a slice down to length len if it is larger than len:

def.name: slice_cut

if slice.size > len
  return slice[0..(len - 1)]
else
  return slice
end

```

class_methods.name: string_sub_chars
class_methods.doc:
Replaces all instances of ms-dos name incompatible chars of a string with "~":

```
my_string = "My.TestString"
WAD.string_sub_chars(my_string) # => "My~Test~String"
```
class_methods.summary: Replaces all instances of ms-dos name incompatible chars of a string with "~":

def.name: string_sub_chars
def.body:
incompatible_chars = ['"', '*', '+', '.', ',', '/', ':', ';', '<', '=', '>', '?', '\\', '[', ']', '|']
new_string = string

incompatible_chars.each do |char|
  new_string = new_string.gsub(char, '~')
end
return new_string

constructors.name: read
constructors.doc:
Reads in a WAD file given the *filename*:

```
my_wad = WAD.read("Path/To/Wad")
```

constructors.name: read
constructors.doc:
Reads in a WAD file given the *io*:

```
File.open("Path/To/Wad") do |file|
  my_wad = WAD.read(file)
end
```
constructors.summary: Reads in a WAD file given the io:

def.name: read
def.body:
invalid_lump_found = false
wad = WAD.new
start_pos = file.pos.to_u32

header_slice = Bytes.new(4)
file.read(header_slice)
string_type = String.new(header_slice)


if string_type =~ (/^IWAD$/)
  wad.type = Type::Internal
elsif string_type =~ (/^PWAD$/)
  wad.type = Type::Patch
else
  raise("TYPE IS BAD: #{string_type}")
end


wad.directories_count = file.read_bytes(UInt32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

wad.directory_pointer = (file.read_bytes(UInt32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)) + start_pos

d_index = 0



while d_index < wad.directories_count
  directory_read = false


  directory_start = wad.directory_pointer + (d_index * Directory::SIZE)

  file.read_at(directory_start, Directory::SIZE) do |io|

    directory = Directory.read(io, start_pos)
    wad.directories << directory

    if !directory_read
      begin
        if Map.is_map?(directory.name)
          map = Map.new(directory.name)


          map_directory_end_reached = false
          while !(map_directory_end_reached)
            d_index = d_index + 1

            directory_start = wad.directory_pointer + (d_index * Directory::SIZE)

            if (directory_start + Directory::SIZE) > (wad.directory_pointer + (wad.directories_count * Directory::SIZE))
              break
            end

            file.read_at(directory_start, Directory::SIZE) do |io|

              directory = Directory.read(io, start_pos)



              if !(Map::MAP_CONTENTS.includes?(directory.name))
                d_index = d_index - 1
                map_directory_end_reached = true
                break
              end

              map.insert_next_property(directory)
            end
          end


          map_parse(things, Thing)
          map_parse(linedefs, Linedef)
          map_parse(sidedefs, Sidedef)
          map_parse(vertexes, Vertex)
          map_parse(segs, Seg)
          map_parse(ssectors, Ssector)
          map_parse(nodes, Node)
          map_parse(sectors, Sector)
          file.read_at(map.reject_directory.file_pos, map.reject_directory.size) do |io|
            map.reject = Map::Reject.parse(io, map.reject_directory.size, map.sectors.size)
          end
          map_parse(blockmap, Blockmap)


          wad.maps[map.name] = map
          directory_read = true
        end
      rescue e
        if throw_errors
          raise("MAP '#{directory.name}' IS INVALID\n#{e}")
        end
        invalid_lump_found = true
      end
    end

    if !directory_read
      begin
        if PcSound.is_pcsound?(directory.name)
          file.read_at(directory.file_pos, directory.size) do |io|
            wad.pcsounds[directory.name] = PcSound.parse(io)
            directory_read = true
          end
        end
      rescue e
        if throw_errors
          raise("PC SOUND '#{directory.name}' IS INVALID\n#{e}")
        end
        invalid_lump_found = true
      end
    end

    if !directory_read
      begin
        if Sound.is_sound?(directory.name)
          file.read_at(directory.file_pos, directory.size) do |io|
            wad.sounds[directory.name] = Sound.parse(io)
            directory_read = true
          end
        end
      rescue e
        if throw_errors
          raise("SOUND '#{directory.name}' IS INVALID\n#{e}")
        end
        invalid_lump_found = true
      end
    end

    if !directory_read
      begin
        if Music.is_music?(directory.name)
          file.read_at(directory.file_pos, directory.size) do |io|
            wad.music[directory.name] = Music.parse(io)
            directory_read = true
          end
        end
      rescue e
        if throw_errors
          raise("MUSIC '#{directory.name}' IS INVALID\n#{e}")
        end
        invalid_lump_found = true
      end
    end

    if !directory_read
      begin
        if Genmidi.is_genmidi?(directory.name)
          file.read_at(directory.file_pos, directory.size) do |io|
            wad.genmidi = Genmidi.parse(io)
            directory_read = true
          end
        end
      rescue e
        if throw_errors
          raise("GENMIDI '#{directory.name}' IS INVALID\n#{e}")
        end
        invalid_lump_found = true
      end
    end

    if !directory_read
      begin
        if Dmxgus.is_dmxgus?(directory.name)
          file.read_at(directory.file_pos, directory.size) do |io|
            wad.dmxgus = Dmxgus.parse(io)
            directory_read = true
          end
        end
      rescue e
        if throw_errors
          raise("DMXGUS '#{directory.name}' IS INVALID\n#{e}")
        end
        invalid_lump_found = true
      end
    end

    if !directory_read
      begin
        if Playpal.is_playpal?(directory.name)
          file.read_at(directory.file_pos, directory.size) do |io|
            wad.playpal = Playpal.parse(io)
            directory_read = true
          end
        end
      rescue e
        if throw_errors
          raise("PLAYPAL '#{directory.name}' IS INVALID\n#{e}")
        end
        invalid_lump_found = true
      end
    end

    if !directory_read
      begin
        if Colormap.is_colormap?(directory.name)
          file.read_at(directory.file_pos, directory.size) do |io|
            wad.colormap = Colormap.parse(io)
            directory_read = true
          end
        end
      rescue e
        if throw_errors
          raise("COLORMAP '#{directory.name}' IS INVALID\n#{e}")
        end
        invalid_lump_found = true
      end
    end

    if !directory_read
      begin
        if TextureX.is_texturex?(directory.name)
          file.read_at(directory.file_pos, directory.size) do |io|
            wad.texmaps[directory.name] = TextureX.parse(io)
            directory_read = true
          end
        end
      rescue e
        if throw_errors
          raise("TEXTURE MAP '#{directory.name}' IS INVALID\n#{e}")
        end
        invalid_lump_found = true
      end
    end

    if !directory_read
      begin
        if EnDoom.is_endoom?(directory.name)
          file.read_at(directory.file_pos, directory.size) do |io|
            wad.endoom = EnDoom.parse(io)
            directory_read = true
          end
        end
      rescue e
        if throw_errors
          raise("ENDOOM '#{directory.name}' IS INVALID\n#{e}")
        end
        invalid_lump_found = true
      end
    end

    if !directory_read
      begin
        if Pnames.is_pnames?(directory.name)
          file.read_at(directory.file_pos, directory.size) do |io|
            wad.pnames = Pnames.parse(io)
            directory_read = true
          end
        end
      rescue e
        if throw_errors
          raise("PNAMES '#{directory.name}' IS INVALID\n#{e}")
        end
        invalid_lump_found = true
      end
    end

    if !directory_read
      begin
        if Graphic.is_sprite_mark_start?(directory.name)
          sprite_directory_end_reached = false
          while !(sprite_directory_end_reached)
            d_index = d_index + 1

            directory_start = wad.directory_pointer + (d_index * Directory::SIZE)

            if (directory_start + Directory::SIZE) > (wad.directory_pointer + (wad.directories_count * Directory::SIZE))
              break
            end

            file.read_at(directory_start, Directory::SIZE) do |io|

              directory = Directory.read(io, start_pos)
              wad.directories << directory



              if Graphic.is_sprite_mark_end?(directory.name)
                sprite_directory_end_reached = true
                break
              end

              (Graphic.parse(file, directory.file_pos, directory.size)).try do |graphic|
                wad.sprites[directory.name] = graphic
              end
            end
          end
          directory_read = true
        end
      rescue e
        if throw_errors
          raise("SPRITE '#{directory.name}' IS INVALID\n#{e}")
        end
        invalid_lump_found = true
      end
    end

    if !directory_read
      begin
        if Flat.is_flat_mark_start?(directory.name)
          flat_directory_end_reached = false
          while !(flat_directory_end_reached)
            d_index = d_index + 1

            directory_start = wad.directory_pointer + (d_index * Directory::SIZE)

            if (directory_start + Directory::SIZE) > (wad.directory_pointer + (wad.directories_count * Directory::SIZE))
              break
            end

            file.read_at(directory_start, Directory::SIZE) do |io|

              directory = Directory.read(io, start_pos)
              wad.directories << directory



              if Flat.is_flat_mark_end?(directory.name)
                flat_directory_end_reached = true
                break
              end

              file.read_at(directory.file_pos, directory.size) do |io|
                begin
                  wad.flats[directory.name] = Flat.parse(io)
                rescue e : IO::EOFError
                end
              end
            end
          end
          directory_read = true
        end
      rescue e
        if throw_errors
          raise("FLAT '#{directory.name}' IS INVALID\n#{e}")
        end
        invalid_lump_found = true
      end
    end

    if !directory_read
      begin
        (Graphic.parse(file, directory.file_pos, directory.size)).try do |graphic|
          wad.graphics[directory.name] = graphic
          directory_read = true
        end
      rescue e
        if throw_errors
          raise("GRAPHIC '#{directory.name}' IS INVALID\n#{e}")
        end
        invalid_lump_found = true
      end
    end

    if !directory_read
      begin
        file.read_at(directory.file_pos, directory.size) do |is_demo_io|
          if Demo.is_demo?(is_demo_io)
            file.read_at(directory.file_pos, directory.size) do |io|
              wad.demos[directory.name] = Demo.parse(io)
              directory_read = true
            end
          end
        end
      rescue e
        if throw_errors
          raise("DEMO '#{directory.name}' IS INVALID\n#{e}")
        end
        invalid_lump_found = true
      end
    end


    d_index = d_index + 1
  end
end

instance_methods.doc:
Allows easy parsing of lumps into the WAD

```
my_wad = WAD.new(WAD::Type::Internal)

File.open("Path/To/Sound.lmp") do |file|

def.name: add
def.body:
case type
when AddTypes::PcSound
  pcsounds[name] = PcSound.parse(file)
  new_dir(name)
when AddTypes::Sound
  sounds[name] = Sound.parse(file)
  new_dir(name)
when AddTypes::Music
  music[name] = Music.parse(file)
  new_dir(name)
when AddTypes::TextureX
  texmaps[name] = TextureX.parse(file)
  new_dir(name)
when AddTypes::Graphic
  (Graphic.parse(file)).try do |graphic|
    graphics[name] = graphic
    new_dir(name)
  end
when AddTypes::Flat
  flats[name] = Flat.parse(file)
  new_dir(name)
when AddTypes::Demo
  demos[name] = Demo.parse(file)
  new_dir(name)
else
  raise("#{type} IS AN INVALID TYPE")
end

instance_methods.name: rename_lump
instance_methods.doc:
Renames a lump that can be renamed in the WAD
Usually used when renaming a directory
instance_methods.summary: Renames a lump that can be renamed in the WAD Usually used when renaming a directory

def.name: rename_lump
def.body:
case what_is?(to_rename)
when "Map"
  maps[name] = maps[to_rename]
  maps.delete(to_rename)
  return true
when "PcSound"
  pcsounds[name] = pcsounds[to_rename]
  pcsounds.delete(to_rename)
  return true
when "Sound"
  sounds[name] = sounds[to_rename]
  sounds.delete(to_rename)
  return true
when "Music"
  music[name] = music[to_rename]
  music.delete(to_rename)
  return true
when "TexMap"
  texmaps[name] = texmaps[to_rename]
  texmaps.delete(to_rename)
  return true
when "Graphic"
  graphics[name] = graphics[to_rename]
  graphics.delete(to_rename)
  return true
when "Sprite"
  sprites[name] = sprites[to_rename]
  sprites.delete(to_rename)
  return true
when "Flat"
  flats[name] = flats[to_rename]
  flats.delete(to_rename)
  return true
when "Demo"
  demos[name] = demos[to_rename]
  demos.delete(to_rename)
  return true
else
  return false
end

def.name: parse
def.body:
colormap = Colormap.new
amount_of_tables = 34
length_of_table = 256

amount_of_tables.times do
  table = Table.new
  length_of_table.times do
    table.table << (io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))
  end
  colormap.tables << table
end

constructors.name: parse
constructors.doc:
Parses an io in a demo format

Reads an io and puts out a demo:
```
File.open("Path/To/Demo") do |file|
  my_demo = WAD::Demo.parse(file)
end
```
constructors.summary: Parses an io in a demo format

def.name: parse
def.body:
demo = Demo.new

demo.game_version = io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
demo.skill_level = io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
demo.episode = io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
demo.map = io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
demo.multiplayer_mode = io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
demo.respawn = ((io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)) != 0)
demo.fast = ((io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)) != 0)
demo.nomonsters = ((io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)) != 0)
demo.player_pov = io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
demo.player1 = ((io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)) == 1)
demo.player2 = ((io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)) == 1)
demo.player3 = ((io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)) == 1)
demo.player4 = ((io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)) == 1)

while (start_byte = io.read_bytes(Int8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)) != -128
  inputaction = InputAction.new

  inputaction.movement_forward_back = start_byte
  inputaction.strafing = io.read_bytes(Int8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  inputaction.turning = io.read_bytes(Int8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  inputaction.action = io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

  action_bits = BitArray.new(8)

  8.times do |time|
    action_bits[time] = (inputaction.action.bit(7 - time)) == 1
  end

  inputaction.expanded_action.special_mode = action_bits[7]

  if inputaction.expanded_action.special_mode
    inputaction.expanded_action.shoot_pause = action_bits[0]
    inputaction.expanded_action.interact_save = action_bits[1]

    if inputaction.expanded_action.interact_save
      if action_bits[2]
        __temp_164 = inputaction.expanded_action
        __temp_164.save_slot = __temp_164.save_slot + 1
      end
      if action_bits[3]
        __temp_165 = inputaction.expanded_action
        __temp_165.save_slot = __temp_165.save_slot + 2
      end
      if action_bits[4]
        __temp_166 = inputaction.expanded_action
        __temp_166.save_slot = __temp_166.save_slot + 4
      end
    end
  else
    inputaction.expanded_action.weapon_switch = action_bits[2]

    if inputaction.expanded_action.weapon_switch
      if action_bits[3]
        __temp_167 = inputaction.expanded_action
        __temp_167.weapon_slot = __temp_167.weapon_slot + 1
      end
      if action_bits[4]
        __temp_168 = inputaction.expanded_action
        __temp_168.weapon_slot = __temp_168.weapon_slot + 2
      end
      if action_bits[5]
        __temp_169 = inputaction.expanded_action
        __temp_169.weapon_slot = __temp_169.weapon_slot + 4
      end
    else
      inputaction.expanded_action.interact_save = action_bits[1]
      inputaction.expanded_action.shoot_pause = action_bits[0]
    end
  end
  demo.input_actions << inputaction
end
demo

constructors.name: read
constructors.doc:
Read an io from the WAD and convert it into a Directory.

Reads a directory from a WAD *file* with *directory_start* and *Directory::SIZE*:
```
file.read_at(directory_start, Directory::SIZE) do |io|
  directory = Directory.read(io)
end
```

NOTE: *file_offset* is used when the start of the WAD is offset in a file
constructors.summary: Read an io from the WAD and convert it into a Directory.

def.name: read
def.body:
directory = Directory.new
directory.file_pos = io.read_bytes(UInt32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
directory.file_pos = directory.file_pos + file_offset
directory.size = io.read_bytes(UInt32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
directory.name = (io.gets(8)).to_s.gsub("\u0000", "")
directory

constructors.name: parse
constructors.doc:
Parses a dmxgus file given the io

Opens a dmxgus io and parses it:
```
File.open("Path/To/Dmxgus") do |file|
  my_dmxgus = WAD::Dmxgus.parse(file)
end
```
constructors.summary: Parses a dmxgus file given the io

def.name: parse
def.body:
dmxgus = Dmxgus.new


io.gets_to_end.each_line do |line|
  if (line.char_at(0)) != '#'
    instr_data = InstrumentData.new

    split_line = line.split(',')

    instr_data.patch = split_line[0].to_i
    instr_data.a_k = split_line[1].to_i
    instr_data.b_k = split_line[2].to_i
    instr_data.c_k = split_line[3].to_i
    instr_data.d_k = split_line[4].to_i
    instr_data.filename = split_line[5]

    dmxgus.instr_datas << instr_data
  end
end

dmxgus

def.name: parse
def.body:
endoom = EnDoom.new
num_of_chars = 2000

num_of_chars.times do
  endoomchar = EnDoomChars.new

  endoomchar.ascii_value = io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  endoomchar.color = io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

  endoom.characters << endoomchar
end
endoom

instance_methods.name: set_pixel
instance_methods.doc:
Sets a pixel in the flat to be *value*.
Raises an error if value is not within the bounds
of a `UInt8`

NOTE: *value* does not refer to an rgb color,
but instead to an index in the colors of a `WAD::Playpal::Palette`

```
my_wad = WAD.read("Path/To/Wad")

my_flat = my_wad.flats["MyFlat"]

my_flat[2, 3] # => Returns the value of the pixel at x=2 y=3

my_flat.set_pixel(2, 3, 120) # => Sets the value of the pixel at x=2 y=3 to be 120

my_flat[2, 3] # => 120

my_flat.set_pixel(2, 3, -1) # => Raises an exception

my_flat.set_pixel(2, 3, 256) # => Raises an exception
```
instance_methods.summary: Sets a pixel in the flat to be value.

def.name: set_pixel
def.body:
if x > width || y > height
  raise("Out of bounds")
end
if self[x, y]
  begin
    colors[x + (y * width)] = value.to_u8
  rescue e : OverflowError
    raise("'#{value}' IS NOT WITHIN THE BOUNDS OF A UInt8")
  end
end

constructors.name: parse
constructors.doc:
Parses a genmidi file given the io

Opens a genmidi io and parses it:
```
File.open("Path/To/Genmidi") do |file|
  my_genmidi = WAD::Genmidi.parse(file)
end
```
constructors.summary: Parses a genmidi file given the io

def.name: parse
def.body:
genmidi = Genmidi.new

genmidi.header = (io.gets(8)).to_s

instrument_data_records_count = 175

instrument_data_records_count.times do
  instr_data = InstrumentData.new


  instr_data.header << (io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))
  instr_data.header << (io.read_bytes(Int8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))
  instr_data.header << (io.read_bytes(Int8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))


  14.times do
    instr_data.voice1_data << (io.read_bytes(Int8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))
  end
  instr_data.voice1_data << (io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))


  14.times do
    instr_data.voice2_data << (io.read_bytes(Int8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))
  end
  instr_data.voice2_data << (io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))

  genmidi.instr_datas << instr_data
end

instrument_data_records_count.times do
  genmidi.instr_names << (io.gets(32)).to_s
end

genmidi

class_methods.name: parse
class_methods.doc:
Parses a graphic file given the file

Opens a graphic file and parses it:
```
File.open("Path/To/Graphic") do |file|
  my_graphic = WAD::Graphic.parse(file)
end
```
class_methods.summary: Parses a graphic file given the file
class_methods.args_string: (file : File, file_pos : Int = 0, size : Int = -1) : Graphic | Nil
class_methods.args_html: (file : File, file_pos : Int = 0, size : Int = -1) : Graphic | Nil

def.name: parse
def.body:
begin
  if size < 0
    size = file.size
  end
  graphic_parse = GraphicParse.new
  graphic = Graphic.new
  file.read_at(file_pos, size) do |g_io|
    graphic.width = g_io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    graphic.height = g_io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    graphic.leftoffset = g_io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    graphic.topoffset = g_io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

    graphic.width.times do
      graphic_parse.columnoffsets << (g_io.read_bytes(UInt32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))
    end

    graphic.file_size = graphic.file_size + ((graphic.width * 4) + 8)

    graphic.width.times do |i|
      file.read_at(file_pos + graphic_parse.columnoffsets[i], size - graphic_parse.columnoffsets[i]) do |c_io|
        rowstart = 0
        column = GraphicParse::Column.new

        loop do
          rowstart = c_io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
          post = GraphicParse::Post.new
          post.topdelta = rowstart
          if rowstart == 255
            graphic.file_size = graphic.file_size + 1
            break
          end

          post.length = c_io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
          graphic.file_size = graphic.file_size + (post.length.to_u32 + 4.to_u32)
          dummy = c_io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)











          pixel_parse(i, column, post, c_io)
          dummy = c_io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
        end

        graphic_parse.columns << column

        if graphic_parse.columns.size == graphic.width
          begin
            while (graphic.file_size < size) && (i = c_io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))
              if i != 0
                break
              end
              graphic.file_size = graphic.file_size + 1
            end
          rescue e : IO::EOFError
          end
        end
      end
    end
  end

  if size == graphic.file_size
    graphic.reset_data
    graphic_parse.columns.each do |column|
      column.posts.each do |post|
        post.row_column_data.each do |pixel|
          graphic.data[pixel.column + (pixel.row * graphic.width)] = pixel.pixel
        end
      end
    end
    return graphic
  else
    return nil
  end
rescue e : IO::EOFError
  return nil
rescue e : ArgumentError
  return nil
rescue e : OverflowError
  return nil
end

types.name: Blockmap
types.doc: Class of a blockmap.
types.summary: Class of a blockmap.

constructors.name: parse
constructors.doc:
Parses a blockmap list given the io and the size

Opens a blockmap lump and parses it:
```
File.open("Path/To/Blockmap") do |file|
  my_blockmap = WAD::Map::Blockmap.parse(file, file.size)
end
```
constructors.summary: Parses a blockmap list given the io and the size

def.name: parse
def.body:
parsed_blockmap = Blockmap.new

parsed_blockmap.header.grid_origin_x = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
parsed_blockmap.header.grid_origin_y = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
parsed_blockmap.header.num_of_columns = io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
parsed_blockmap.header.num_of_rows = io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

blockmap_length = lump_size - (2 * 4)

parsed_blockmap.num_of_blocks.times do |time|

  parsed_blockmap.offsets << (io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))

  blockmap_length = blockmap_length - 2
end

blocklist = Blockmap::Blocklist.new

loop do

  if blockmap_length < 2
    break
  end

  read_byte = io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

  blockmap_length = blockmap_length - 2

  if read_byte != 65535
    blocklist.linedefs_in_block << read_byte
  else
    parsed_blockmap.blocklists << blocklist

    blocklist = Blockmap::Blocklist.new
  end
end

parsed_blockmap

types.summary: Structure of a linedef.

class_methods.name: parse
class_methods.doc:
Parses a linedefs list given the io and the size

Opens a linedefs lump and parses it:
```
File.open("Path/To/Linedef") do |file|
  my_linedefs = WAD::Map::Linedef.parse(file, file.size)
end
```
class_methods.summary: Parses a linedefs list given the io and the size

def.name: parse
def.body:
parsed_linedefs = [] of Linedef

linedefs_index = 0

entry_length = 14

while (linedefs_index * entry_length) < lump_size
  linedef = Linedef.new

  linedef.start_vertex = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  linedef.end_vertex = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  linedef.flags = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  linedef.special_type = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  linedef.sector_tag = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  linedef.front_sidedef = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  linedef.back_sidedef = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

  linedefs_index = linedefs_index + 1

  parsed_linedefs << linedef
end

parsed_linedefs

class_methods.name: parse
class_methods.doc:
Parses a nodes list given the io and the size

Opens a nodes lump and parses it:
```
File.open("Path/To/Node") do |file|
  my_nodes = WAD::Map::Node.parse(file, file.size)
end
```
class_methods.summary: Parses a nodes list given the io and the size

def.name: parse
def.body:
parsed_nodes = [] of Node

nodes_index = 0

entry_length = 28

while (nodes_index * entry_length) < lump_size
  node = Node.new

  node.x_coord = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  node.y_coord = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  node.x_change_to_end = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  node.y_change_to_end = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)



  node.right_bound_box << (io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))
  node.right_bound_box << (io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))
  node.right_bound_box << (io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))
  node.right_bound_box << (io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))

  node.left_bound_box << (io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))
  node.left_bound_box << (io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))
  node.left_bound_box << (io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))
  node.left_bound_box << (io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))

  node.right_child = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  node.left_child = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

  nodes_index = nodes_index + 1

  parsed_nodes << node
end

parsed_nodes

types.name: Reject
types.doc: Class of a reject.
types.summary: Class of a reject.

constructors.name: parse
constructors.doc:
Parses a reject list given the io and the size

Example: Opens a reject lump and parses it
```
File.open("Path/To/Reject") do |file|
  my_reject = WAD::Map::Reject.parse(file, file.size)
end
```
constructors.summary: Parses a reject list given the io and the size
constructors.args_string: (io : IO, lump_size : Int, sectors : Int = 0) : Reject
constructors.args_html: (io : IO, lump_size : Int, sectors : Int = 0) : Reject

def.name: parse
def.body:
reject = Reject.new

reject_size = (sectors ** 2) / 8

reject_index = 0

sector_byte_loop = 0

byte_slice = Bytes.new(lump_size)

io.read_fully(byte_slice)

byte_slice_array = byte_slice.to_a
reject.byte_data = byte_slice.to_a

bit_array = BitArray.new(sectors ** 2)

sectors.times do |y|

  sectors.times do |x|

    bit_array[x + (y * sectors)] = (byte_slice_array[0].bit(sector_byte_loop)) == 1

    if sector_byte_loop == 7
      sector_byte_loop = 0

      byte_slice_array.delete_at(0)
    else
      sector_byte_loop = sector_byte_loop + 1
    end
  end

  reject_index = reject_index + 1
end

reject.data = bit_array
reject

class_methods.summary: Parses a sectors list given the io and the size

def.name: parse
def.body:
parsed_sectors = [] of Sector

sectors_index = 0

entry_length = 26

while (sectors_index * entry_length) < lump_size
  sector = Sector.new

  sector.floor_height = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  sector.ceiling_height = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  sector.name_tex_floor = (io.gets(8)).to_s.gsub("\u0000", "")
  sector.name_tex_ceiling = (io.gets(8)).to_s.gsub("\u0000", "")
  sector.light_level = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  sector.special_type = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  sector.tag_num = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

  sectors_index = sectors_index + 1

  parsed_sectors << sector
end

parsed_sectors

def.name: parse
def.body:
parsed_sidedefs = [] of Sidedef

sidedefs_index = 0

entry_length = 30

while (sidedefs_index * entry_length) < lump_size
  sidedef = Sidedef.new

  sidedef.x_offset = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  sidedef.y_offset = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  sidedef.name_tex_up = (io.gets(8)).to_s.gsub("\u0000", "")
  sidedef.name_tex_low = (io.gets(8)).to_s.gsub("\u0000", "")
  sidedef.name_tex_mid = (io.gets(8)).to_s.gsub("\u0000", "")
  sidedef.facing_sector_num = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

  sidedefs_index = sidedefs_index + 1

  parsed_sidedefs << sidedef
end

parsed_sidedefs

types.doc: A music track.
types.summary: A music track.

class_methods.name: is_music?
class_methods.doc:
Checks to see if *name* is music with name format 'D_x..x'.

Returns true if the name is a music:
```
music_name = "D_E1M1"
if WAD::Music.is_music?(music_name)
  puts "Is a Music"
else
  puts "Is not a Music"
end
```
class_methods.summary: Checks to see if name is music with name format 'D_x..x'.

```

def.body:

  return self.parse(file)
end

raise("Music invalid")

constructors.name: parse
constructors.doc:
Parses a music file given the io

Opens a music io and parses it:
```
File.open("Path/To/Music") do |file|
  my_music = WAD::Music.parse(file)
end
```
constructors.summary: Parses a music file given the io

def.name: parse
def.body:
music = Music.new
music.raw = io.getb_to_end.to_a
io.rewind

music.identifier = (io.gets(4)).to_s
music.score_len = io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
music.score_start = io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
music.channels = io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
music.sec_channels = io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
music.instr_cnt = io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)


music.instr_cnt.times do
  music.instruments << (io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))
end


loop do
  begin
    music.song << (io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))
  rescue e : IO::EOFError
    break
  end
end

music

def.name: parse
def.body:
playpal = Playpal.new
colors_per_palette = 256
amount_of_palettes = 14

amount_of_palettes.times do
  palette = Palette.new
  (colors_per_palette).to_i.times do
    color = Color.new
    color.r = io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    color.g = io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    color.b = io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    palette.colors << color
  end
  playpal.palettes << palette
end
playpal

Checks to see if *name* is a sound with name format 'DSx..x'.

Returns true if the name is a sound:
```
sound_name = "DSNOWAY"
if WAD::Sound.is_sound?(sound_name)
  puts "Is a Sound"
else
  puts "Is not a Sound"
end
```
class_methods.summary: Checks to see if name is a sound with name format 'DSx..x'.

constructors.name: from_wav
constructors.doc:
Converts a .wav file to a `WAD::Sound` given a *filename*

```
my_wav_sound = WAD::Sound.from_wav("Path/To/Sound.wav")
```
constructors.summary: Converts a .wav file to a WAD::Sound given a filename

def.name: from_wav
def.body:
filename = filename.to_s
if filename[filename.rindex!('.'), filename.size - 1] != ".wav"
  filename = filename + ".wav"
end
File.open(filename) do |io|
  return self.from_wav(io)
end

constructors.name: from_wav
constructors.doc:
Converts a .wav file to a `WAD::Sound` given a *io*

```
File.open("Path/To/Sound.wav") do |io|
  my_wav_sound = WAD::Sound.from_wav(io)
end
```
constructors.summary: Converts a .wav file to a WAD::Sound given a io

def.name: from_wav
def.body:
sound = Sound.new
sound.format_num = 3_u16

begin
  io.gets(4)

  io.read_bytes(UInt32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

  io.gets(8)

  io.read_bytes(UInt32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

  io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

  io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

  sound.sample_rate = io.read_bytes(UInt32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

  io.read_bytes(UInt32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

  io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

  if (io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)) != 8_u16
    raise(".wav is not 8bit")
  end

  io.gets(4)

  sound.samples_num = io.read_bytes(UInt32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)


  sound.samples_num.times do
    sound.samples << (io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))
  end

  return sound
rescue e : IO::EOFError
  raise("Not a valid .wav")
end

constructors.name: parse
constructors.doc:
Parses a sound lump.

Opens a sound io and parses it:
```
File.open("Path/To/Sound") do |file|
  my_sound = WAD::Sound.parse(file)
end
```
constructors.summary: Parses a sound lump.

def.name: parse
def.body:
sound = Sound.new
sound.format_num = io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
sound.sample_rate = io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
sound.samples_num = io.read_bytes(UInt16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)


(PAD_BYTES + 2).times do
  io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
end

sample_index = 0
while sample_index < (sound.samples_num - (PAD_BYTES * 2))
  sound.samples << (io.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))
  sample_index = sample_index + 1
end

sound

instance_methods.summary: Returns a copy of self with all instance variables cloned.

def.name: clone
def.body:
{% if @type < ::Reference && !@type.instance_vars.map(&.type).all? do |t| ((((t == ::Bool) || (t == ::Char)) || (t == ::Symbol)) || (t == ::String)) || t < ::Number::Primitive end %}
        exec_recursive_clone do |hash|
          clone = {{ @type }}.allocate
          hash[object_id] = clone.object_id
          clone.initialize_copy(self)
          ::GC.add_finalizer(clone) if clone.responds_to?(:finalize)
          clone
        end
      {% else %}
        clone = {{ @type }}.allocate
        clone.initialize_copy(self)
        ::GC.add_finalizer(clone) if clone.responds_to?(:finalize)
        clone
      {% end %}

instance_methods.name: to_wav
instance_methods.doc:
Writes to wav file given an output *file* and returns the written file's size.

Writes a 'wav' file from the *my_wad* sound "DSPISTOL":
```
my_wad.sounds["DSPISTOL"].to_wav("Path/To/MyWav.wav")
```
instance_methods.summary: Writes to wav file given an output file and returns the written file's size.

def.name: to_wav
def.body:
filename = filename.to_s
if filename[filename.rindex!('.'), filename.size - 1] != ".wav"
  filename = filename + ".wav"
end
File.open(filename, "w+") do |io|
  to_wav(io)
end

instance_methods.name: to_wav
instance_methods.doc:
Writes to wav file given an output *io* and returns the written file's size.

Writes a 'wav' file from the *my_wad* sound "DSPISTOL":
```
File.open("Path/To/MyWav.wav", "w+") do |io|
  my_wad.sounds["DSPISTOL"].to_wav(io)
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Writes to wav file given an output io and returns the written file's size.

def.name: to_wav
def.body:
file_size = 0_u32

io << "RIFF"
file_size = file_size + 4_u32

io.write_bytes(((4 + 24) + 8) + samples.size.to_u32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
file_size = file_size + 4_u32
io << "WAVEfmt "
file_size = file_size + 8_u32

io.write_bytes(16_u32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
file_size = file_size + 4_u32

io.write_bytes(1_u16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
file_size = file_size + 2_u32

io.write_bytes(1_u16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
file_size = file_size + 2_u32

io.write_bytes(sample_rate.to_u32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
file_size = file_size + 4_u32

io.write_bytes(sample_rate.to_u32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
file_size = file_size + 4_u32

io.write_bytes(1_u16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
file_size = file_size + 2_u32

io.write_bytes(8_u16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
file_size = file_size + 2_u32
io << "data"
file_size = file_size + 4_u32

io.write_bytes(samples.size.to_u32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
file_size = file_size + 4_u32


samples.each do |sample|
  io.write_bytes(sample, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  file_size = file_size + 1_u32
end

return file_size

constructors.name: parse
constructors.doc:
Parses a texture map file given the io

Opens a texture map io and parses it:
```
File.open("Path/To/TextureMap") do |file|
  my_texturemap = WAD::TextureX.parse(file)
end
```
constructors.summary: Parses a texture map file given the io

def.name: parse
def.body:
texturex = TextureX.new
texturex.numtextures = io.read_bytes(Int32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)


texturex.numtextures.times do
  texturex.offsets << (io.read_bytes(Int32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian))
end

texturex.offsets.each do
  texturemap = TextureMap.new
  texturemap.name = (io.gets(8)).to_s.gsub("\u0000", "")
  texturemap.masked = (io.read_bytes(Int32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)) != 0
  texturemap.width = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  texturemap.height = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  texturemap.columndirectory = io.read_bytes(Int32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  texturemap.patchcount = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

  texturemap.patchcount.times do
    patch = Patch.new

    patch.originx = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    patch.originy = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    patch.patch = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    patch.stepdir = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    patch.colormap = io.read_bytes(Int16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

    texturemap.patches << patch
  end
  texturex.mtextures << texturemap
end
texturex

types.name: WritingAdditions
types.doc:
### Additions to allow wa-cr to write to files

To use these additions, just require it:

```
require "wa-cr/write"
```

Here's some examples of this addition:

```
require "wa-cr/write"

File.open("Path/To/Test.file") do |file|
  # Writes a full wad
  my_wad.write(file) # => Size of the written file

  # Writes lumps return the size of the written lump
  my_demo.write(file) # => Size of the written file

  my_sound.write(file)   # => Size of the written file
  my_pcsound.write(file) # => etc.

  my_music.write(file) # => etc.
  my_genmidi.write(file) # => etc.
  my_dmxgus.write(file) # => etc.

  my_playpal.write(file) # => etc.
  my_colormap.write(file) # => etc.
  my_endoom.write(file) # => etc.
  my_texturemap.write(file) # => etc.
  my_pnames.write(file) # => etc.
  my_graphic.write(file) # => etc.
  my_flat.write(file) # => etc.
```

### Map Data

  To write specific map data, you have to use
  the class methods and put in the file to
  write, and the parsed map data you want to write:

```
File.open("Path/To/Test.file") do |file|
  my_map.write(file) # => An array of all written directories in the order listed below

  Map::Thing.write(file, my_things : Array)              # => The written file's directory
  Map::Linedef.write(file, my_linedefs : Array)          # => The written file's directory
  Map::Sidedef.write(file, my_sidedefs : Array)          # => etc.
  Map::Vertex.write(file, my_vertexs : Array)            # => etc.
  Map::Seg.write(file, my_segs : Array)                  # => etc.
  Map::Ssector.write(file, my_ssectors : Array)          # => etc.
  Map::Node.write(file, my_nodes : Array)                # => etc.
  Map::Sector.write(file, my_sectors : Array)            # => etc.
  Map::Reject.write(file, my_reject : Map::Reject)       # => etc.
  Map::Blockmap.write(file, my_blockmap : Map::Blockmap) # => etc.
end
```


### Quick Writing

  wa-cr's writing additions' methods also have overloads
  to write to a file by just providing the file path

```
# Writes a full wad
my_wad.write("Path/To/File") # => Size of the written file

# Writes lumps return the size of the written lump
my_demo.write(file) # => Size of the written file

my_sound.write("Path/To/File")   # => Size of the written file
my_pcsound.write("Path/To/File") # => etc.

my_music.write("Path/To/File")   # => etc.
my_genmidi.write("Path/To/File") # => etc.
my_dmxgus.write("Path/To/File")  # => etc.

my_playpal.write("Path/To/File")    # => etc.
my_colormap.write("Path/To/File")   # => etc.
my_endoom.write("Path/To/File")     # => etc.
my_texturemap.write("Path/To/File") # => etc.
my_pnames.write("Path/To/File")     # => etc.
my_graphic.write("Path/To/File")    # => etc.
my_flat.write("Path/To/File")       # => etc.

# Map Data
my_map.write("Path/To/File") # => An array of all written directories in the order listed below

Map::Thing.write("Path/To/File", my_thing : Array)             # => The written file's directory
Map::Linedefwrite("Path/To/File", my_linedefs : Array)         # => The written file's directory
Map::Sidedef.write("Path/To/File", my_sidedefs : Array)         # => etc.
Map::Vertex.write("Path/To/File", my_vertexes : Array)         # => etc.
Map::Seg.write("Path/To/File", my_segs : Array)                 # => etc.
Map::Ssector.write("Path/To/File", my_ssectors : Array)         # => etc.
Map::Node.write("Path/To/File", my_nodes : Array)               # => etc.
Map::Sector.write("Path/To/File", my_sectors : Array)           # => etc.
Map::Reject.write("Path/To/File", my_reject : Map::Reject)       # => etc.
Map::Blockmap.write("Path/To/File", my_blockmap : Map::Blockmap) # => etc.
```
types.summary: Additions to allow wa-cr to write to files

def.name: write

io.write_bytes(respawn.to_unsafe.to_u8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

io.write_bytes(fast.to_unsafe.to_u8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
lump_size = lump_size + 1_u32
io.write_bytes(nomonsters.to_unsafe.to_u8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

  io.write_bytes(input_action.strafing.to_i8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

  io.write_bytes(input_action.turning.to_i8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

def.name: write
def.body:
lump_size = 0_u32

instr_datas.each do |instr_data|
  io.print(instr_data.patch.to_s)
  lump_size = lump_size + instr_data.patch.to_s.bytesize.to_u32
  io.print(",")
  lump_size = lump_size + ",".bytesize.to_u32

  io.print(instr_data.a_k.to_s)
  lump_size = lump_size + instr_data.a_k.to_s.bytesize.to_u32
  io.print(",")
  lump_size = lump_size + ",".bytesize.to_u32

  io.print(instr_data.b_k.to_s)
  lump_size = lump_size + instr_data.b_k.to_s.bytesize.to_u32
  io.print(",")
  lump_size = lump_size + ",".bytesize.to_u32

  io.print(instr_data.c_k.to_s)
  lump_size = lump_size + instr_data.c_k.to_s.bytesize.to_u32
  io.print(",")
  lump_size = lump_size + ",".bytesize.to_u32

  io.print(instr_data.d_k.to_s)
  lump_size = lump_size + instr_data.d_k.to_s.bytesize.to_u32
  io.print(",")
  lump_size = lump_size + ",".bytesize.to_u32

  io.print(instr_data.filename)
  lump_size = lump_size + instr_data.filename.bytesize.to_u32
  io.print("\n")
  lump_size = lump_size + "\n".bytesize.to_u32
end
lump_size

def.name: write
def.body:
lump_size = 0_u32

io.print(header)
lump_size = lump_size + header.bytesize.to_u32

instr_datas.each do |instr_data|
  io.write_bytes(instr_data.header[0].to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
  io.write_bytes(instr_data.header[1].to_i8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 1_u32
  io.write_bytes(instr_data.header[2].to_i8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 1_u32


  14.times do |time|
    io.write_bytes(instr_data.voice1_data[time].to_i8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    lump_size = lump_size + 1_u32
  end
  io.write_bytes(instr_data.voice1_data[14].to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32


  14.times do |time|
    io.write_bytes(instr_data.voice2_data[time].to_i8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    lump_size = lump_size + 1_u32
  end
  io.write_bytes(instr_data.voice2_data[14].to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
end

instr_names.each do |name|
  name_slice = Bytes.new(32)
  name_slice.copy_from(::WAD.slice_cut((::WAD.string_cut(name, 32)).to_slice, 32))
  io.write(name_slice)
  lump_size = lump_size + 32_u32
end
lump_size

def.name: write
def.body:
file_start_position = io.pos
dummy_value = 0_u8
pixel_count = 0_u8
lump_size = 0_u32
column_offsets = [] of UInt32
offset = 0_u32

io.write_bytes(width.to_u16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
io.write_bytes(height.to_u16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
io.write_bytes(leftoffset.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
io.write_bytes(topoffset.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

buffer = IO::Memory.new

width.times do |x|
  column_offsets << buffer.pos.to_u32
  y = 0_u8
  operator = true
  empty_post = false

  while !(y == height)
    pixel = self[x.to_i, y.to_i]

    if pixel.nil? && (!operator)
      operator = true
      if y != (height - 1)
        buffer.write_bytes(dummy_value.to_u8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
        empty_post = true
      end
    elsif (!pixel.nil?) && operator
      empty_post = false
      row_start = y
      pixel_count = 1_u8
      dummy_value = 0_u8

      buffer.write_bytes(row_start.to_u8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
      buffer.write_bytes(pixel_count.to_u8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
      buffer.write_bytes(dummy_value.to_u8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

      offset = buffer.pos.to_u32
      operator = false

      buffer.write_bytes(pixel.to_u8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    elsif (!pixel.nil?) && (!operator)
      empty_post = false
      pixel_count = pixel_count + 1_u8

      if offset > 0 && pixel_count > 0
        previous_offset = buffer.pos
        buffer.pos = (offset - 2)
        buffer.write_bytes(pixel_count.to_u8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
        buffer.pos = previous_offset
      end

      buffer.write_bytes(pixel.to_u8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    end

    y = y + 1_u8
  end

  if operator || (y == height)
    if buffer.pos != 0
      if empty_post
        buffer.pos = (buffer.pos - 1)
      end

      buffer.pos = (buffer.pos - 1)

      if (buffer.read_bytes(UInt8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)) != 255
        pixel = 0

        buffer.write_bytes(pixel.to_u8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
      end

      row_start = 255

      buffer.write_bytes(row_start.to_u8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    else
      row_start = 255

      buffer.write_bytes(row_start.to_u8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    end
  end
end

buffer.pos = 0

offset = io.pos - file_start_position

io.pos = file_start_position + 8

column_offsets.size.times do |time|
  column_offset = (column_offsets[time] + offset) + (column_offsets.size * 4)

  io.write_bytes(column_offset.to_u32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
end

IO.copy(buffer, io)

lump_size = io.pos.to_u32 - file_start_position.to_u32
lump_size

def.name: write
def.body:
written_directory = ::WAD::Directory.new
written_directory.name = "BLOCKMAP"
written_directory.file_pos = io.pos.to_u32

lump_size = 0_u32

io.write_bytes(header.grid_origin_x.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
io.write_bytes(header.grid_origin_y.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
io.write_bytes(header.num_of_columns.to_u16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
io.write_bytes(header.num_of_rows.to_u16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32

offsets.each do |offset|
  io.write_bytes(offset.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
end

blocklists.each do |blocklist|
  io.write_bytes(0_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
  blocklist.linedefs_in_block.each do |value|
    io.write_bytes(value.to_u16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
  end
end

io.write_bytes(65535_u16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32

written_directory.size = lump_size.to_u32
written_directory

def.name: write
def.body:
written_directory = ::WAD::Directory.new
written_directory.name = "NODES"
written_directory.file_pos = io.pos.to_u32

lump_size = 0_u32

nodes.each do |node|
  io.write_bytes(node.x_coord.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
  io.write_bytes(node.y_coord.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
  io.write_bytes(node.x_change_to_end.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
  io.write_bytes(node.y_change_to_end.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32

  node.right_bound_box.each do |value|
    io.write_bytes(value.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
  end

  node.left_bound_box.each do |value|
    io.write_bytes(value.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
  end

  io.write_bytes(node.right_child.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
  io.write_bytes(node.left_child.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
end

written_directory.size = lump_size.to_u32
written_directory

def.name: write
def.body:
written_directory = ::WAD::Directory.new
written_directory.name = "SECTORS"
written_directory.file_pos = io.pos.to_u32

lump_size = 0_u32

sectors.each do |sector|
  io.write_bytes(sector.floor_height.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
  io.write_bytes(sector.ceiling_height.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32

  name_slice = Bytes.new(8)
  name_slice.copy_from(::WAD.slice_cut((::WAD.string_cut(sector.name_tex_floor)).to_slice))
  io.write(name_slice)
  lump_size = lump_size + 8_u32

  name_slice = Bytes.new(8)
  name_slice.copy_from(::WAD.slice_cut((::WAD.string_cut(sector.name_tex_ceiling)).to_slice))
  io.write(name_slice)
  lump_size = lump_size + 8_u32

  io.write_bytes(sector.light_level.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
  io.write_bytes(sector.special_type.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
  io.write_bytes(sector.tag_num.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
end

written_directory.size = lump_size.to_u32
written_directory

written_directory = ::WAD::Directory.new
written_directory.name = "SIDEDEFS"

  io.write(name_slice)
  lump_size = lump_size + 8_u32

  io.write_bytes(sidedef.facing_sector_num.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
end
written_directory.size = lump_size.to_u32

def.body:
lump_size = 0_u32

io.print(identifier)
lump_size = lump_size + 4_u32

instruments.each do |instrument|
  io.write_bytes(instrument.to_u16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
end

song.each do |value|

end

def.body:
lump_size = 0_u32

io.write_bytes(format_num.to_u16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)

lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
io.write_bytes(samples_num.to_u16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32


io.write_bytes(0.to_u16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32

::WAD::Sound::PAD_BYTES.times do
  io.write_bytes(samples[0].to_u8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 1_u32
end

samples.each do |sample|
  io.write_bytes(sample.to_u8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 1_u32
end

::WAD::Sound::PAD_BYTES.times do
  io.write_bytes(samples[-1].to_u8, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 1_u32
end

lump_size

def.name: write
def.body:
lump_size = 0_u32

io.write_bytes(numtextures.to_i32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
lump_size = lump_size + 4_u32

offsets.each do |offset|
  io.write_bytes(offset.to_i32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 4_u32
end

mtextures.each do |texture|
  name_slice = Bytes.new(8)
  name_slice.copy_from(::WAD.slice_cut((::WAD.string_cut(texture.name)).to_slice))
  io.write(name_slice)
  lump_size = lump_size + 8_u32

  if texture.masked
    io.write_bytes(1.to_i32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    lump_size = lump_size + 4_u32
  else
    io.write_bytes(0.to_i32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    lump_size = lump_size + 4_u32
  end

  io.write_bytes(texture.width.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
  io.write_bytes(texture.height.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
  io.write_bytes(texture.columndirectory.to_i32, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 4_u32
  io.write_bytes(texture.patchcount.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
  lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32

  texture.patches.each do |patch|
    io.write_bytes(patch.originx.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
    io.write_bytes(patch.originy.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
    io.write_bytes(patch.patch.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
    io.write_bytes(patch.stepdir.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
    io.write_bytes(patch.colormap.to_i16, IO::ByteFormat::LittleEndian)
    lump_size = lump_size + 2_u32
  end
end
lump_size

types.name: WAD
types.doc:
Reads, writes, and stores the data of a WAD file.

This helps write out parsed `::WAD` files to a .wad:

```
require "wa-cr/write"

my_wad = WAD.read("Path/To/Wad")

File.open("Path/To/MyWad.WAD", "w+") do |file|
  my_wad.write(file)
end
```

You can also write from new `::WAD` files:

```
require "wa-cr/write"

my_wad = WAD.new

# You'll need to set the WAD type for new WAD's
my_wad.type = WAD::Type::Internal

File.open("Path/To/MyWad.WAD") do |file|
  my_wad.write(file)
end
```
types.summary: Reads, writes, and stores the data of a WAD file.

instance_methods.name: write
instance_methods.doc:
Writes a WAD class to an file and returns the written file's size

Writes a wad file to *my_new_wad.WAD*:
```
my_wad = WAD.read("Path/To/Wad")
my_wad.write("Path/To/my_wad.WAD")
```
instance_methods.summary: Writes a WAD class to an file and returns the written file's size

instance_methods.name: write
instance_methods.doc:
Writes a WAD class to an io and returns the written file's size

Writes a wad file to *my_new_wad.WAD*:
```
my_wad = WAD.read("Path/To/Wad")
File.open("Path/To/my_new_wad.WAD", "w+") do |file|
  my_wad.write(file)
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Writes a WAD class to an io and returns the written file's size

def.name: write
def.body:
file_size : UInt32 = 0_u32
written_directories : Array(::WAD::Directory) = [] of ::WAD::Directory
write_directory_pointer : UInt32 = 0_u32

_write_header(io)

directories.each do |directory|
  written_directory = ::WAD::Directory.new
  written_directory.name = directory.name
  written_directory.file_pos = io.pos.to_u32

  if ::WAD::Genmidi.is_genmidi?(directory.name)
    written_directory.size = genmidi.write(io)
    written_directories << written_directory
    next
  end

  if ::WAD::Dmxgus.is_dmxgus?(directory.name)
    written_directory.size = dmxgus.write(io)
    written_directories << written_directory
    next
  end

  if ::WAD::Playpal.is_playpal?(directory.name)
    written_directory.size = playpal.write(io)
    written_directories << written_directory
    next
  end

  if ::WAD::Colormap.is_colormap?(directory.name)
    written_directory.size = colormap.write(io)
    written_directories << written_directory
    next
  end

  if ::WAD::EnDoom.is_endoom?(directory.name)
    written_directory.size = endoom.write(io)
    written_directories << written_directory
    next
  end

  if ::WAD::Pnames.is_pnames?(directory.name)
    written_directory.size = pnames.write(io)
    written_directories << written_directory
    next
  end

  if maps[directory.name]?
    written_directory.size = 0
    written_directories << written_directory
    (maps[directory.name].write(io)).each do |lump_dir|
      written_directory = ::WAD::Directory.new
      written_directory.name = lump_dir.name
      written_directory.file_pos = lump_dir.file_pos
      written_directory.size = lump_dir.size
      written_directories << written_directory
    end
    next
  end

  if pcsounds[directory.name]?
    written_directory.size = pcsounds[directory.name].write(io)
    written_directories << written_directory
    next
  end

  if sounds[directory.name]?
    written_directory.size = sounds[directory.name].write(io)
    written_directories << written_directory
    next
  end

  if music[directory.name]?
    written_directory.size = music[directory.name].write(io)
    written_directories << written_directory
    next
  end

  if texmaps[directory.name]?
    written_directory.size = texmaps[directory.name].write(io)
    written_directories << written_directory
    next
  end

  if graphics[directory.name]?
    written_directory.size = graphics[directory.name].write(io)
    written_directories << written_directory
    next
  end

  if sprites[directory.name]?
    written_directory.size = sprites[directory.name].write(io)
    written_directories << written_directory
    next
  end

  if flats[directory.name]?
    written_directory.size = flats[directory.name].write(io)
    written_directories << written_directory
    next
  end

  if demos[directory.name]?
    written_directory.size = demos[directory.name].write(io)
    written_directories << written_directory
    next
  end

  written_directory.size = 0
  written_directories << written_directory
end

write_directory_pointer = io.pos.to_u32

written_directories.each do |written_directory|
  _write_directory(io, written_directory)
end

file_size = io.pos.to_u32

io.pos = 0

_write_header(io, written_directories.size.to_u32, write_directory_pointer)
file_size
